oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Herman Crook interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording contains an interview with Herman Crook, followed by the Judds, as conducted by Biff Collie. Recording also contains various news segments for Biff Collie's radio program.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:03) Herman Crook talks about playing on the National Barn Dance and at the Ryman Auditorium, and how that show transitioned into the Grand Ole Opry -- (01:38) Crook talks about being lucky to have been picked to stay on as a performer at the Opry, and getting paid to do so -- (02:30) Biff says hello to Ott Devine -- (03:21) Ott Devine talks (incomplete) -- (03:34) Biff Collie talks about a show being co-hosted by Roy Clark and a different star each week -- (03:48) Biff talks about wanting to get an interview with the Judds -- (04:15) The Judds talk about singing when they were young girls in order to get out of doing chores -- (04:43) The Judds talk about touring and their relationship with each other as a mother and daughter -- (05:51) Biff talks about wanting to do another interview with the Judds in the future -- (06:12) Biff talks about the Grand Ole Opry exhibit at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum -- (07:06) Biff talks about his mail contact information and Dolly Parton's book Wild Flowers -- (08:03) Biff talks about T. G. Shepard joining the car racing business and Kenny Rogers as well -- (08:30) Biff talks about Roy Clark's interest in the equine arts and Mel Tillis growing molasses -- (08:58) Biff talks about Mickey Gilley and Urban Cowboy starring John Travolta -- (09:27) Biff talks about Jerry Reed's lawsuit with AAMCO oil company -- (09:52) Biff talks about the Judds rise to fame in a short time -- (10:27) Biff talks about the the opposition of "hillbilly" music in Nashville in the 1920's and how the Grand Ole Opry got it's name, the longest running radio show in history -- (11:25) Biff does some of his mailbag entries from listeners -- (12:30) Biff talks about Willie Nelson teaching Sunday school and Waylon studying ministry -- Biff talks about Larry Gatlin's clothing designer -- Biff talks about the Ozark Jubilee in the 1950's and Ralph Foster -- (13:33) Biff talks about Hawkshaw Hawkins, Cowboy Copas, and Patsy Cline dying in a plane crash, and all the songs that have been written about the event -- (14:37) Biff talks about Hall of Famer Ralph Peer being considered the father of country music -- (15:44) Biff talks about Johnny Russell's pizza restaurant (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Crook, Herman; Collie, Biff; Judds (Musical group); Judd, Wynonna, 1964-; Judd, Naomi; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994;
